alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 02 at 2:53PM CDT until September 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected due to high waves and onshore winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Several beaches that will be most susceptible to the dangerous swimming conditions include FOR NORTH TO EAST FLOW USE: Big Bay Beach in the Village of Whitefish Bay... Mckinley Beach in Milwaukee... North Beach in Racine...
info.instruction: Stay out of the water and away from dangerous areas like piers and breakwalls. Strong structural and longshore currents are expected. Rip currents are possible.
